section.title: About scheduled reports

listitem.para: A scheduled report gets its content from existing dashboards.
A scheduled report lists the dashboard items in the same order as on the dashboard.
A scheduled report can only contain dashboard items with charts, maps or tables.
You create the report and the schedule in the Maintenance app.

The Title and Message parameters you set up in the Maintenance app, are included in each report. The Name you give the report is not included in the report. Instead, the name is used to identify the push analysis object in the system. This way a report can be named one thing, and the title of the report can be another.

When you run a scheduled report job, the system compiles a list of recipients from the user groups you've selected. The system then generates a report for each member of the selected user groups. Each of the dashboard items are generated specifically for each user. This means that the data included in the report reflects the data the user has access to. All users could therefore get the same report (if all the data is "static") or custom reports (if all the data is "dynamic"), or a combination of the two.

The scheduled reports are sent by e-mail to the recipients, not through the internal DHIS2 messaging system. If a user doesn't have a valid e-mail, or if the job fails, no e-mails are sent. In this case, the problem is logged on the server.

note.para: The data generated in the reports is public so verify that you don't include any sensitive data.

section.para: In the Maintenance app, you manage the following scheduled reports objects:

table.title: Scheduled reports objects in the Maintenance app

entry.para: Create, edit, clone, delete, show details and translate

listitem.para: Open the Maintenance app and click Other > Push analysis.
Click the add button.
In the Name field, type the name of the scheduled report.
This name is not included in the report e-mail. Instead, the name is used to identify the push analysis object in the system.
(Optional) In the Code field, assign a code.
Add a report Title.
This title is included in the report e-mail.
(Optional) Add a Message.
This message is included in the report e-mail.
Select a Dashboard to base the report on.
Select and assign the user groups you want to send the report to.
Select a Scheduling frequency: Daily, Weekly or Monthly.

note.para: If you schedule a report to "Monthly" and "31", the scheduled report job will not run if the month has less than 31 days.

listitem.para: (Optional) Select Enable to activate the scheduled report job.
The job won't run until you activate it.
(Optional) Click Run to run the scheduled report job immediately.
Click Save.
